page.title: 19Four Local Primary Schools.
page.content: The four schools described briefly below,have collated the information contained on these pages. St.Annes was endowed by a local mine and mill owning family in 1887 as an all age Church School. Now it has 207 infants and juniors and is of C.P. status.Flowery Field Primary School was built about 25 yrs. ago to replace the original school built by Ashton Bros.Ltd. to educate workers' children.There are about 600 children on roll.Greenfield School cost Â£23,700 to build in 1929. Senior children are upstairs with the juniors below, we have 230 children in 8 classes and a nursery.Saint John Fisher Roman Catholic Primary School was opened in 1963. There are 123 children on roll, divided into 5 classes. The building is surrounded by large playing fields and has a flat roof, recently repaired
